Posted: June 29, 2015
												Psychedelic masterpiece owing a debt to the Serious Sam school of fast-paced game design. Solid colors rammed through the bleariest of lighting filters. Megaman running and gunning on the transforming terrain of ExciteTruck, a 3D shooter spiritually in tune with by-gone arcade shooters. Flashbacks of Ratchet and Clank: Going Commando and the Jak and Daxter games but with a DIY cell-shaded anime aesthetic. On max settings, it is all bold tones smeared in radioactive light. Tune in, turn on, and be taken in the soft parade of energy orbs.

												Caster! The game that pretty much has crappy graphics but still gets intense on Expert mode! This game is pretty good, but it could be waaayy better. The story makes a little bit of sense, but it seems that it's too easy, even on Expert mode, it just takes longer to kill enemies due to the fact that they move and shoot faster. All you do is collect these Energy Spheres and kill off Bugs, then enter the exit zone to continue to the next level. It's currently on sale for 20 cents so it's worth trying it out, considering the fact that you also get 6 powers to use!!!! Good luck on this game that looks like it was made in 2000! MYAAH!

Posted: December 30, 2015
												Caster is third-person shooter where the player controls an inexperienced hero. This hero descends from a rare lineage of people with extraordinary abilities that interact unusually with both the terrain and the plants that sprout from it. The player is employed by an organization to eliminate an incursion of beasts known as the Flanx, bug-like monsters that dwell in water, land, and air. I've beat this game a total of 16 times, doing someting different each time. I wanted to see if there was a different outcome in the end, but it still feels like the ending level is the most difficult, and the only challenging. Getting this game for $0.17 was probably my best idea yet.

Posted: December 23, 2015
												This is a weird game, but despite its obviously cheap producation values, it's fun. It's a third-person shooter with light RPG elements. All of the weapons feel different and stay useful throughout the game. The levels utilize the weapon mechanics to provide creative solutions to various scenarios. The only problem is the length. I almost beat it a second time on expert before I received its trading cards. There are more levels online, plus modding tools, but for those who won't bother with that, the game may feel limited. At standard price, it may not seem like enough, but at a discount, it's an entertaining way to spend time, even if only for an hour or two.

												This game is great.  The music was well chosen and gives the game a very chill feel.  For the price, this is the best decision I've ever made.  It doesnt take long to beat and only a few of the levels will give you a real challenge, however it's simply fun to run around murdering bugs and terraforming the world around you.I highly recommend this game.  It's cheap, and you'll get a few great hours out of it.

Posted: January 11, 2016
												The game is not buggy, I'll give it that, but a game is not good just because it's cheap and isn't completely broken. The game is short and uninteresting, enemies are dumb and gameplay is horrible. Even though I got this as a joke gift from my friend, it still felt like a waste of time. The game may have potential, but potential isn't enough to make a game enjoyable. And since it's been 7 years I don't see them fixing anything, even though the game itself promises there will be more. It's not even worth the low cost. Buy a lollipop or save those cents for something more worthy.

Posted: December 14, 2016
												A short game that combines sandbox with MegaMan-esque power-ups. Two powers affect the terrain around you, which creates some diversity, two are for crowd control, and the other two are strictly for damage. Though personally, Blast (terrain damager) is the most powerful because of how fast you can fire it off and how much damage it does when fully charged.The levels have the same few objectives: go this tree/kill all the enemies/collect all the orbs. It's rather mundane, but for a fantasy? It's great. You run around each level, jumping really high and dashing really fast, obliterating everything in your way.At the current price ($1.99), I would not recommend it. During a sale, definitely.

												Entertaining little game, good for people who just wanna get to shooting.Has a simple story line and great gameplay.And the powers are freaking fun and generally new.The fast and free movement is also something to make a note off,since combining it with the varied powers makes for fun annihilations !Njoy folks.
